Package core_components

Class DrawingJPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • core_components.DrawingJPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class DrawingJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Panel for drawing items. Supports simple drawing guides, such as snap and grid.
    Since:
    Dec 7, 2017
    Version:
    a. Dec 29, 2017 : Added functionality for editing the vertices of a feature b. Dec 31, 2017 : Added functionality for dragging/ moving a point feature
    Author:
    Olumide Igbiloba
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toggleEditSession

        public void toggleEditSession​(int layerIndex,
                              java.lang.String featureType,
                              java.lang.String signal)
        Toggles the edit session
        Parameters:
        layerIndex - the index of the layer on the table of contents or from the combo box
        featureType - the current feature type to draw
        signal - specify not to toggle edit session but to change current editing layer by using "continue"

      • finishPath

        public java.awt.geom.Path2D finishPath​(java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D> pointList,
                                       Layer currentLayer)
        Finish drawing of a path, if the current layer is a polygon, the path will be closed and filled
        Creates a new feature in the current layer
        Parameters:
        pointList - the current list of points (should be more than 3) to set
        currentLayer - the current Layer to set
        Returns:
        returns the path

      • cleanUpDrawing

        public void cleanUpDrawing​()
        Cleans up the drawing. Panel repainted automatically.

      • showAnimatedHint

        public void showAnimatedHint​(java.lang.String message,
                             java.awt.Color stateColor)
        Shows animated hint on the drawing panel.
        This can be turned on/off at the settings frame.
        Parameters:
        message - the Message to display
        stateColor - the state color e.g Settings.LAYER_CREATED_COLOR
